Material used.Description: HEK293 cells overexpressing mutant PARKIN (c.145G>A, c.380A>G, c.1016A>G) or wild-type PARKIN were used.

Readout description.Result Description: Mutant PARKIN (p.G49R) failed to localize to mitochondria and impaired mitophagy.
Mutant PARKIN (p.Y127C) showed reduced ubiquitin ligase activity but retained some mitochondrial localization.
Mutant PARKIN (p.Y339C) exhibited partial mitochondrial localization and reduced PINK1 interaction.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated three times in technical replicates.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PARKIN-expressing cells served as a positive control for mitochondrial localization and mitophagy.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells served as a negative control for PARKIN function.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare fluorescence intensity and mitophagy rates across groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Mitochondrial PARKIN localization > 75% and mitophagy rate > 60%.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Mitochondrial PARKIN localization < 30% and mitophagy rate < 20%.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells expressing PARKIN variants were lysed and analyzed for protein levels.

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression of p.G49R PARKIN was undetectable compared to wild-type.
p.Y127C PARKIN showed 50% reduced protein stability compared to wild-type.
p.Y339C PARKIN exhibited 30% reduced protein stability compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated three times in technical replicates.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PARKIN protein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: t-test was used to compare protein expression levels between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: PARKIN protein expression ≥ 80% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: PARKIN protein expression < 40% of wild-type levels.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells expressing PARKIN variants were used to analyze PINK1 interaction.

Readout description.Result Description: p.G49R PARKIN showed no interaction with PINK1.
p.Y127C PARKIN exhibited 30% reduced PINK1 interaction.
p.Y339C PARKIN showed 60% reduced PINK1 interaction.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated three times in technical replicates.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PARKIN was used as a positive control for PINK1 interaction.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: t-test was used to compare PINK1 interaction levels between groups.
